snippet: Ms. Kennedy was arraigned on charges of driving under the influence of drugs but released on her own recognizance, on the condition that she be fingerprinted and undergo a substance abuse evaluation.
abstract: Kerry Kennedy pleads not guilty to charges of driving under the influence of drugs, and blames a possible partial seizure for collision with a tractor-trailer in Westchester County; she says that testing showed that neither drugs nor alcohol had been in her system at the time of the accident; Kennedy is released on her own recognizance pending an August hearing.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Wendy Ruderman reported from Armonk, and Michael Schwirtz from New York.

lead_paragraph: Ms. Kennedy was arraigned on charges of driving under the influence of drugs but released on her own recognizance, on the condition that she be fingerprinted and undergo a substance abuse evaluation.

headline.seo: Kerry Kennedy Cites Possible Seizure in Car Crash
headline.main: Kerry Kennedy Cites Possible Seizure, Not Drugs, in Car Crash
headline.print_headline: Kerry Kennedy Cites Possible Seizure, Not Drugs, in Car Crash
